titleStmt.title: SII 14.64: original edition by A. S. Ramanatha Ayyar
No. 64. (A.R. No. 118 of 1910.) ŚŌḺAVANDĀṈ, MADURAI TALUK, MADURAI DISTRICT. ON A SLAB SET UP IN THE PLATFORM OF THE RAILWAY STATION.

summary.p: This Vaṭṭeḻuttu record dated in 2+12th year of Śaḍaiya-Māṟaṉ registers a gift of 25 cows by Vēḷāṉ-Paḍāri, wife of Teṉṉavaṉ Aṇukkappēraraiyaṉ alias Paṇayaṉ Māṇikkaṉ of Perumbāgaṉūr in Pāgaṉūr-kūṟṟam, for a lamp to the temple of Peruntirukkōyil-Dēvar of Tirumāṉam, a brahmadēya in Pāgaṉūr-kūṟṟam. The cows were left in the charge of two priests of the temple (aganāḻigaiyār) named Nāraṇaṉ-Mādēvaṉ and Munnūṟṟuvan-Tiruvārū[ra]ṉ. The slab on which the inscription is engraved must have originally belonged to some Śiva temple in the vicinity and been removed to the station site later on.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)
